params.text:
Crop Establishment

The following are the recommended crop establishment practices for squash:

• Plant at a distance of 1-2 m between plants in the row/plot and 5-10 or 10-15 m between pair in rows/plot (Fig. 2). Squash can creep on soil surface and grows up to 15 m.

  • If area is fully exposed to sunlight, plant at a distance of 1-2 m between hills in a row and 5-10 m between the pair bed.

  • If area is with growing trees (e.g. mango or coconut), plant at a distance of 1-2 m between plants in the row and 10-15 m between pair bed.

Fertilizer Application

The following are the recommended nutrient management practices for squash production:

  • Plant in soil rich in organic fertilizer nutrients to obtain high crop yield. 

  • Apply 20-30 g per hill/plant or approximately 2-3 tbsp. full of complete fertilizer (14-14-14).

  • Apply a mixture of urea and muriate of potash at 10-20 g per hill four weeks after planting or transplanting.

Hand Pollination

  • When insect pollinators are few, hand pollination should be done to increase fruit setting. This can be done by inserting the male flower to the female flower which is of the same age.

  • The best time to hand pollinate is in the morning between 6:00 and 8:00.
